title: Data Management and Sharing for Researchers Training Programme
abstractText:
This project, funded as part of the ESRC's Researcher Development Initiative, aimed to provide practical training and training materials for students, researchers and support staff in the social sciences on key issues pertinent to managing and sharing social science research data.

The emphasis was on focused activities in an area of need recognised across the UK - on all aspects of 'data handling'. Training covered the core skills that are vital for the practices of both primary data collection and secondary analysis.These are:

 

  • why and how to share research data; ethics, consent and confidentiality when sharing research data
  • copyright and the use of existing data resources; data description, contextualisation and documentation
  • data formats and software; and data storage, back-up, and security.

These skills, which we are envisaging will become an integral part of all post-graduate training programmes, should not only maximise the impact of a researcher's own research but also foster greater appreciation of the use of secondary sources. A programme of workshops was held held around the country, with a number of travel bursaries available for post-graduate students.
